Grill server configuration

The configuration parameters and their default values
No. Property Name Default Value Description
1 grill.appevent.ws.listener.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.GrillApplicationListener Implementation class for Grill Application Listener
2 grill.authentication.ws.filter.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.AuthenticationFilter Implementation class for Authentication Filter
3 grill.consistentState.ws.filter.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.ConsistentStateFilter Implementation class for ConsistentState Filter
4 grill.drivers com.inmobi.grill.driver.hive.HiveDriver Drivers enabled for this grill server instance
5 grill.enable.console.metrics false Enable metrics to be reported on console
6 grill.enable.ganglia.metrics false Enable metrics to be reported on ganglia
7 grill.event.service.thread.pool.size The size of thread pool for notifying events. The no value is specified, it uses the available processors as the number.
8 grill.index.ws.resource.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.IndexResource Implementation class for Index Resource
9 grill.mail.from.address blah@company.com The from field in the notifier mail to the submitter.
10 grill.mail.host mail-host.company.com SMTP Host for sending mail
11 grill.mail.port 25 SMTP Port
12 grill.mail.smtp.connectiontimeout 15000 Socket connection timeout value in milliseconds. This timeout is implemented by java.net.Socket. Default is 15 seconds.
13 grill.mail.smtp.timeout 30000 Socket read timeout value in milliseconds. This timeout is implemented by java.net.Socket. Default is 30 seconds.
14 grill.max.finished.queries 100 Maximum number of finished queries which grill server will keep in memory before purging.
15 grill.metastore.service.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.metastore.CubeMetastoreServiceImpl Implementation class for metastore service
16 grill.metastore.ws.resource.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.metastore.MetastoreResource Implementation class for Metastore Resource
17 grill.metrics.ganglia.host The ganglia host name
18 grill.metrics.ganglia.port The ganglia port
19 grill.metrics.reporting.period 10 The reporting period for metrics. The value is in seconds
20 grill.multipart.ws.feature.impl org.glassfish.jersey.media.multipart.MultiPartFeature Implementation class for query scheduler resource
21 grill.query.service.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.query.QueryExecutionServiceImpl Implementation class for query execution service
22 grill.query.state.logger.enabled true Disable or enable the query state logger with this config. The location for the logger can be specified in log4j properties for the class com.inmobi.grill.server.query.QueryExecutionServiceImpl.QueryStatusLogger
23 grill.query.ws.resource.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.query.QueryServiceResource Implementation class for Query Resource
24 grill.quota.service.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.quota.QuotaServiceImpl Implementation class for quota service
25 grill.quota.ws.resource.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.quota.QuotaResource Implementation class for Quota Resource
26 grill.scheduler.service.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.scheduler.QuerySchedulerServiceImpl Implementation class for query scheduler service
27 grill.scheduler.ws.resource.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.scheduler.ScheduleResource Implementation class for query scheduler resource
28 grill.server.base.url http://localhost:9999/grillapi/ The base url for the grill server
29 grill.server.db.driver.name org.hsqldb.jdbcDriver Database driver for database where Finished queries have to be stored.
30 grill.server.db.jdbc.pass JDBC Password for Finished queries table
31 grill.server.db.jdbc.url jdbc:hsqldb:/tmp/grillserver/queries.db JDBC URL where the database for storing finished queries is located.
32 grill.server.db.jdbc.user SA JDBC User for Finished queries table
33 grill.server.domain company.com Server domain. This will be used in authentication and Sending emails to users. For the server, the username will be without domain and domain will come through conf.
34 grill.server.mode OPEN The mode in which server should run. Allowed values are OPEN, READ_ONLY, METASTORE_READONLY, METASTORE_NODROP. OPEN mode will allow all requests. READ_ONLY mode will allow all requests on session resouce and only GET requests on all other resources. METASTORE_READONLY will allow GET on metastore and all other requests in other services. METASTORE_NODROP will not allow DELETE on metastore, will allow all other requests.
35 grill.server.persist.location file:///tmp/grillserver The directory in which grill server will persist its state when it is going down. The location be on any Hadoop compatible file system. Server will read from the location when it is restarted and recovery is enabled. So, Server should have both read and write permissions to the location
36 grill.server.recover.onrestart true If the flag is enabled, all the services will be started from last saved state, if disabled all the services will start afresh
37 grill.server.restart.enabled true If flag is enabled, all the services will be persisted to persistent location passed.
38 grill.server.service.provider.factory com.inmobi.grill.server.ServiceProviderFactoryImpl Service provider factory implementation class. This parameter is used to lookup the factory implementation class name that would provide an instance of ServiceProvider. Users should instantiate the class to obtain its instance. Example -- Class spfClass = conf.getClass("grill.server.service.provider.factory", null, ServiceProviderFactory.class); ServiceProviderFactory spf = spfClass.newInstance(); ServiceProvider serviceProvider = spf.getServiceProvider(); -- This is not supposed to be overridden by users.
39 grill.server.session.timeout.seconds 86400 Grill session timeout in seconds.If there is no activity on the session for this period then the session will be closed.Default timeout is one day.
40 grill.server.snapshot.interval 300000 Snapshot interval time in miliseconds for saving grill server state.
41 grill.server.ui.base.uri http://localhost:19999/ The base url for the Grill UI Server
42 grill.server.ui.enable.caching true Set this to false to disable static file caching in the UI server
43 grill.server.ui.static.dir webapp/grill-server/static The base directory to server UI static files from
44 grill.server.user.resolver.custom.class full.package.name.Classname In case the provided implementations are not sufficient for user config resolver, a custom classname can be provided. Class should extend com.inmobi.grill.server.user.UserConfigLoader
45 grill.server.user.resolver.db.driver.name org.hsqldb.jdbcDriver For database based user config loader, the database driver class
46 grill.server.user.resolver.db.jdbc.password For database based user config loader, the jdbc password
47 grill.server.user.resolver.db.jdbc.url jdbc:hsqldb:/tmp/grill_user_config_loader.db For database based user config loader, jdbc url of the database
48 grill.server.user.resolver.db.jdbc.username SA For database based user config loader, the jdbc username
49 grill.server.user.resolver.db.keys grill.session.cluster.user,mapred.job.queue.name For database based user config loader, the conf keys that will be loaded from database.
50 grill.server.user.resolver.db.query select clusteruser,queue from user_config_table where username=? For database based user config loader, this query will be run with single argument = logged in user and the result columns will be assigned to grill.server.user.resolver.db.keys in order.
51 grill.server.user.resolver.fixed.value when grill.server.user.resolver.type=FIXED, This will be the value cluster user will resolve to.
52 grill.server.user.resolver.propertybased.filename /path/to/propertyfile when grill.server.user.resolver.type is PROPERTYBASED, then this file will be read and parsed to determine cluster user. example schema of the file is: user1, user2, user3 = clusteruser1 user4, user5 = clusteruser2 * = clusteruser3
53 grill.server.user.resolver.type FIXED Type of user config resolver. allowed values are FIXED, PROPERTYBASED, DATABASE, CUSTOM.
54 grill.serverMode.ws.filter.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.ServerModeFilter Implementation class for ServerMode Filter
55 grill.servicenames session,query,metastore,scheduler,quota These services would be started in the specified order when grill-server starts up
56 grill.session.service.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.session.HiveSessionService Implementation class for session service
57 grill.session.ws.resource.impl com.inmobi.grill.server.session.SessionResource Implementation class for Session Resource
58 grill.statistics.db grillstats Database to which statistics tables are created and partitions are added.
59 grill.statistics.log.rollover.interval 3600000 Default rate which log statistics store scans for rollups in milliseconds.
60 grill.statistics.store.class com.inmobi.grill.server.stats.store.log.LogStatisticsStore Default implementation of class used to persist Grill Statistics.
61 grill.statistics.warehouse.dir file:///tmp/grill/statistics/warehouse Default top level location where stats are moved by the log statistics store.
62 grill.ws.featurenames multipart These JAX-RS Feature(s) would be started in the specified order when grill-server starts up
63 grill.ws.filternames authentication,consistentState,serverMode These JAX-RS filters would be started in the specified order when grill-server starts up
64 grill.ws.listenernames appevent These listeners would be called in the specified order when grill-server starts up
65 grill.ws.resourcenames session,metastore,query,quota,scheduler,index These JAX-RS resources would be started in the specified order when grill-server starts up
66 hive.server2.async.exec.threads 5 Number of threads required in async thread pool for query execution in the grill directly. Grill uses query execution directly only to add and delete resources, which are mostly synchronous. So keeping to a lower value.
67 hive.server2.authentication NONE Client authentication types. NONE: no authentication check LDAP: LDAP/AD based authentication KERBEROS: Kerberos/GSSAPI authentication CUSTOM: Custom authentication provider (Use with property hive.server2.custom.authentication.class) PAM: Pluggable authentication module.
68 hive.server2.authentication.ldap.Domain The ldap domin
69 hive.server2.authentication.ldap.baseDN LDAP base DN
70 hive.server2.authentication.ldap.security.protocol ssl Its value is a string determined by the service provider (e.g. "ssl"). If this property is unspecified, the behaviour is determined by the service provider. It's value will be directly passed as "java.naming.security.protocol"
71 hive.server2.authentication.ldap.url LDAP connection URL
72 hive.server2.log.redirection.enabled false Disable the log direction on the grill server sessions. There are no logs required for each session in grill sessions. This will decrease number of file handles associated to grill server.
